definition: lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend

sentences.english: When Solomon offered up the temple, the holy fire once again came down from heaven.
sentences.chinese: 所罗门献殿之时，圣火再次从天而降。

sentences.english: Mr. Whitelaw's benevolence would descend like soothing balm .
sentences.chinese: 怀特洛先生的仁慈就会象甘露一样从天而降。

sentences.english: Caused the air-to-ground missile to obtain "dropped from the clouds strikes the hand fiercely suddenly" the title.
sentences.chinese: 使得空地导弹获得了“从天而降的突烈击手”的称号。

sentences.english: Around 5,000 dead red-winged blackbirds dropped from the sky in Arkansas.
sentences.chinese: 阿肯色州有5，000只红翅黑鹂从天而降死亡。

sentences.english: No one knows why there is aerolite from the sky.
sentences.chinese: 没有人知道为什么会有陨石从天而降。

sentences.english: Again, from the heavens, the voice bellowed, There are no fish under the ice.
sentences.chinese: 再次，从天而降的声音吼道，“冰下没有鱼。”

sentences.english: The alarming object falling from the sky was recognized for what it was, this time.
sentences.chinese: 而这次人们确认从天而降令人惶恐的物体究竟是什么。

sentences.english: The beautiful snow is suffusing from the sky.
sentences.chinese: 迷漫的雪花从天而降，飘洒飞扬。

sentences.english: The heavy rain crazy black sky drop from the clouds, like the collapse of.
sentences.chinese: 大雨疯狂地从天而降，黑沉沉的天就像要崩塌下来。

sentences.english: Giants balls of furry lava the size of mammoths raining from the sky.
sentences.chinese: 像长毛象般大的圆球形羽毛状熔岩将会从天而降。

sentences.english: Beginning the first year, God stone drop from the clouds, scattered in the world.
sentences.chinese: 太初元年，有神石从天而降，四散人间。

sentences.english: A jaw-dropping feat of volcanic architecture has risen in the Italian city of Nola, just a stone's throw away from the cataclysmic Mt. Vesuvius.
sentences.chinese: 一个从天而降的建筑奇迹在意大利小城诺拉诞生。

sentences.english: I thought all my ancestors would descend from heaven to congratulate me.
sentences.chinese: 我当时以为我的祖先会从天而降来向我道贺。

definition: lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
coming right into one's face/imminent/to put first
loudly/with a loud bang/a loud rumble
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
